entry.title: how to create a free blog with octopress and github
entry.content:
Introduction

This is a tutorial on how to create a free blog with Octopress and Github for greenhands, well just like me! I am a PhD student in Information Systems and would like to share what I learned with others through a blog. But I know little about html and web development… markdown really saved my life. If you are interested in coding a blog like me, this tutorial might be helpful.

PS: This is a tutorial on mac OSX Yosemite.

  • Install Ruby
  • Install and Configure Octopress
  • Deploy your Blog
  • Start to Write!
  • Errors You Might Run Into

0.Get your Github account

At the beginning, make sure that you have a Github account and add a repository in the format like username.github.io. No other names allowed! If you’d like a cool name like blackpumpkin, please purchase one on godaddy.

1.Install Ruby

Firstly, open your Terminal and then type the code below.

$ curl -L http://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable --ruby
$ rvm install 2.0
$ rvm use 2.0
$ rvm rubygems latest

2.Install and Configure Octopress

$ git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git coder_blog

There are two ways to install theme. If you would like to find some cool and stylish theme, then you should definitely use third-party theme.

Install default theme

$ cd octopress
$ gem install bundler
$ bundle install
$ rake install

Install third-party theme

$ cd octopress
$ git clone git://github.com/panks/fabric.git .themes/fabric
$ rake install['fabric']
$ rake generate

You can pick up a theme you like here. But remember to adapt the code above.

Configuration

Now you have to open the ‘_config.yml’ and change the url title sbutitle author. If you are interested in, you can also enable some third party services there.

Deploy your Blog

$ rake setup_github_pages[git@github.com:yourname/yourname.github.io.git]
$ rake generate
$ rake deploy

Now you need to play a round of Doodle Jump and drink a cup of coffee. Then you can visit your own homepage.

Start to Write!

The default format of blog is markdown. It is quite easy to learn how to use it. Try it and you’ll love it.

$ rake new_post["title"]

Then you can find a file like source/_posts/YYYY-MM-DD-title.markdown. Open it with Mou or some markdown editor you like. Start writing! When you finish it, you need simply follow the steps:

$ rake generate
$ rake watch
$ rake preview # preview your blog at http://localhost:4000
$ rake deploy

More techniques about blogging: Blogging basics

PS (but very important)

Sorry, I put it in the last merely because where I ran into these errors which has driven me crazy. You might run into the following error and find the following helpful:

Building Warining: Layout 'nil' requested in blog/tags/git/atom.xml do

Here is the solution: find the files

  • source/atom.xml
  • source/robots.txt
  • source/_includes/custom/category_feed.xml

Replace layout: null with layout:nil

Don’t ask me why… If you are curious, please ask google.

Woohoo! I’m satisfied with my own blog right now. What about you?
